            "yapping": "**Addressing App Overflow**\n\nI've been examining the CSS of the app container and noticed its fixed 9/16 aspect ratio. It appears that when the viewport is wider, the height stretches to fill the screen (100vh), and the width is automatically determined. This layout is causing the undesirable character overflow beyond the visible boundaries, as the characters are not constrained by the container. I am looking at how to make characters not spill over.\n\n\n**Refining Character Boundaries**\n\nMy focus is shifting to how characters are positioned within the `duck-scene`. I've noted the `duck-scene` occupies a significant portion of the `ai-explanation-screen`. I'm now examining the absolute positioning of each character within the scene, and how their relative sizes and positions might contribute to the overflow issue. I need to ensure they respect the container's bounds regardless of viewport size. I will review the `main.js` setup for each character and how they are displayed.\n\n\n**Examining Character Positioning**\n\nI'm now zeroing in on the absolute positioning within `main.js`. Specifically, the negative `left` value for `mallard-2` raises a red flag.  This suggests it might be positioned outside the `duck-scene`, which has `width: 100%`. I will be double-checking all the  characters' positions. I will be reviewing all the size attributes, and checking whether these sizes, combined with the position attributes, could cause overflow.\n\n\n**Adjusting Character Placements**\n\nI am now focusing on the positioning of the characters, especially those with negative `left` values or positions near the right edge. I noticed `mallard-2` and `mallard-1` are likely culprits for the overflow. My immediate plan is to adjust their `left` properties to keep them fully within the `duck-scene`. I will also scrutinize the height and aspect ratio of each character to understand their visible footprint and prevent any overlaps, making sure that their calculated width is within the allowed bounds. I need to fine-tune the character positions to avoid any overflow issues, considering various screen sizes.\n\n\n**Analyzing Character Positioning**\n\nI'm now zeroing in on positioning, specifically the negative `left` for `mallard-2` and potential overruns at the right edge. I need to ensure characters remain within bounds, given the `duck-scene`'s `width: 100%`. I'll adjust problematic `left` values and consider using `translateX(-50%)` for right-edge characters. I need to prevent spillover at all screen sizes.\n\n\n**Resolving Character Spillage**\n\nI've examined the `main.js` character setup and identified a primary cause: negative `left` values and insufficient space for right-aligned characters. For instance, `mallard-2` with `left: '-10%'` is partially outside the visible area. I plan to adjust problematic `left` properties to keep characters within the `duck-scene`. I will also assess aspect ratios to prevent right-edge overflows at all screen sizes.\n\n\n**Addressing Overflow Prevention**\n\nI'm now implementing the adjustments I've planned. I'm modifying character positions in `main.js` to eliminate overflow, particularly for `mallard-2` and `mallard-1`. Specifically, I'm adjusting their `left` values to ensure they remain within the visible boundaries, taking into account their respective widths and the screen's aspect ratio. This should fix the issue for now.\n\n\n**Rectifying Character Overflow**\n\nI'm now implementing the calculated adjustments to prevent character overflow. I've modified the `left` properties in `main.js` for `mallard-2` to `0%` and `mallard-1` to `65%`. The goal is to constrain them within `duck-scene` boundaries. I'll test the changes to verify the fix across various screen sizes, ensuring the characters remain fully visible without spillage.\n\n\n**Adjusting Character Positioning**\n\nI've significantly adjusted character positions within `main.js`, particularly `mallard-2` from `-10%` to `0%` and `mallard-1` from `80%` to `65%`. These adjustments, coupled with a change for `swan` to `70%`, should prevent the overflow issue. I will confirm the fix works across various viewports.\n\n\n**Implementing Visual Adjustments**\n\nI'm now in the process of applying the revised positioning values to the characters in the scene. Specifically, I'm setting the `left` property of `mallard-2` to `0%` and `mallard-1` to `65%`.  I have to ensure that all changes align with the scene's boundaries. I'm also reviewing each character, ensuring none overspill at the right side of the screen.\n\n\n\nI understand you've noticed that some characters are appearing partially outside the screen. This is happening because their positions are defined from their left edge, without always accounting for their width, especially when they are near the sides of the scene.\n\nI'll adjust the positioning logic to center the characters on their specified coordinates. This will ensure that when a character is placed at the edge of the screen (e.g., at 0% or 100% from the left), it will be perfectly half-on and half-off screen, but never fully outside of it. I'll also adjust the default positions to bring them more comfortably within view.\n\nHere are the changes for `main.js` and `style.css`:\n\n```main.js\n```\n\n```style.css\n```"
